description.desc1: Used to display the rendered result to an output device like a screen or projector.
description.desc2: The window node can slice its frame into (so called) viewports, arranged in rows and columns. Each slice (viewport) can be addressed with a ViewPort-node.
description.desc3: With the display-setup tool you can easily define the windows output size and postion relative to the desktop display.

desktop.descript: switch between the desktop position and the designated output position

display....descript: opens the display-setup tool to define the output position of this window.

slice into.descript: slice the frame into the designated amount of rows (max 2) and columns (max 12)

border.descript: when selected the windows borders are shown when positioned on the desktop.

floating.descript: window will always stay on the foreground

esc.descript: when pressing 'esc' the Window will display mode will switch between desktop and output position.

sync.descript: tries to sync the output framerate with the displays update frequency

interact.descript: exposes an internal transformation node for direct 3d handling similar to the 3DViewer. The transformation node needs to be attached to a Camera-node, and its Capture-node renders out to this Window.

Notes.note1: close this help window if you dont need it. it actually blocks one of the four in SPARCK available windows...
